title: Screen brightness increases after alt tabbing
body: When alt tabbing in while in game ( not in loading screen ) screen just becomes twice as bright. I have checked and disabled game dvr and game bar ( idk the difference ) but nothing fixes it, playing and alt tabbing out of other games doesn't mess with my brightness. I should clarify that i only tried it with osu! and Path Of Exile since i don't play any other games then those 3.

replies.body:
That's definitely a unique issue. There might be something on your pc like auto-brightness or gamma altering settings that are causing your screen to readjust whenever going back to the desktop. Here are some general steps you can take for different video cards to reset any of those settings back to default!

- AMD
 - Right-click on your desktop and select Catalyst Control Center.
 - In the upper-right corner of the window, select Preferences.
 - Select Restore Factory Defaults.
- NVIDIA
 - Right-click on your desktop and select Nvidia Control Panel.
 - Click Manage 3D Settings.
 - In the upper-right corner, click Restore Defaults.
- INTEL
 - Right-click on your desktop and select Graphics Properties.
 - Click 3D.
 - Click Restore Defaults.

Hit me back and let me know if that helps!

Yeah i tried the nvidia one , and it didn't help at all , so i just reverted to before the creators update and that fixed everything.
So just wait until they flesh out all the bugs in creators update or u are  forced to download it

The funny thing is that the game has regular brightness when I'm playing, it's only when going out of the game that the brightness increases dramatically. I usually turn night mode on/off to reset the brightness to normal, but it is an annoyance and a tremendous strain on the eyes..

Has anyone found a solution to this? 
(I can't revert to the previous build either, since that option does not show up in my settings at all.)
